channel.title: New aspects of language
channel.description:
A discussion series about linguistics featuring students and faculty from Nashville University Center and led by Dr. Gerd Fraenkel of the George Peabody College for Teachers. Produced by WPLN and the Nashville Public Library.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Dial-A-Linguist
item.description: In this final program of the series, Dr. Fraenkel and his guests answer the question: where do we find linguists organizationally when we need them? Dr. Fraenkel make the distinction between organizations that connect linguists for their own professional purposes--to give them the potential to exchange ideas and perhaps foster some publications--and some other organizations where teachers in need of linguistic information for teaching programs can find professional help.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Teaching

item.title: Teaching High School Students
item.description: Continuing the focus on applied linguistics, Dr. Fraenkel talks with teachers of ninth and tenth-grade English students about classroom teaching of high school students
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Teaching

item.title: Urban Dialect
item.description: Dr. Fraenkel is joined by Ravin McDavid, Jr., an expert in urban dialects.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Urban dialects

item.title: Words
item.description: Dr. Fraenkel describes four branches of science devoted to the meaning and structure of words: etymology, semantics, historical linguistics, and lexicology.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: Teaching English as a Foreign Language
item.description: In this final episode devoted to applied linguistics, instructors from George Peabody College for Teachers and Vanderbilt University discussed teaching English as a second language to foreign-born speakers.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Teaching

item.title: Linguistic Theory
item.description: This episode focuses on theoretical problems concerning the theory of language and features contributions by a biolinguist--tying language to the biological nature of humans--and a psycholinguist, representing an interdisciplinary connection between linguistics and psychology.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: Child Language
item.description: This program features two guest speakers from Vanderbilt University on the subject of how children learn language--and how we learn how children learn language.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: Teaching Teachers
item.description: This episode presents a panel discussion on applied linguistics--teaching the teachers--recorded during a linguistics class at the George Peabody College for teachers.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Teaching

item.title: The Linguist and the Informant
item.description: Dr. Fraenkel addresses the techniques linguists use to analyze a language based on working with native speakers.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: Interlinguistics
item.description: Dr. Fraenkel discusses interlinguistics, constructed languages used for international communications.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: What Does Modern Linguistics Do?
item.description: This program features a panel discussion on the definition of linguistics--the scientific analysis of language--as well as a description of what linguists do.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Speech & Language

item.title: Linguistic Hardware
item.description: In this program, Dr. Fraenkel discusses electronic technologies available to the linguist for phonetic analysis, including the tape recorder, the sound spectrometer, and the computer.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Technology

item.title: Teaching Teachers of Foreign Language
item.description: Professors from George Peabody College for Teachers, Vanderbilt University, and Austin Peay State University joined Dr. Fraenkel to to discuss another aspect of applied linguistics: teaching teachers of foreign languages.
item.dc:creator: Nashville Public Radio
item.dc:subject: Teaching
